name: Saint Martina
summary: Martina of Rome, a patron saint of Rome, was martyred in 226 under the pontificate of Pope Urban I, according to others. Her feast day is 30 January.
biography: Martina of Rome, a patron saint of Rome, was martyred in 226 under the pontificate of Pope Urban I, according to others. Her feast day is 30 January.
